metadata.title: CVE-2021-43534 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 93 and Firefox ESR 91.2. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 94, Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR <91.3.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
